001package imagingbook.lib.image;
002
003import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
005import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
006import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
008import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
009
010/**
011 * This class defines methods to perform arbitrary geometric transformations
012 * on images. The geometric transformation (mapping) must be specified at
013 * construction, optionally a pixel interpolation method can be specified.
014 * 
015 * The specified geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
016 * <strong>target to source</strong> coordinates!
017 * 
018 * @version 2021/08/27
019 *
020 */
021public class ImageMapper {
022        
023        /** Default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
024        public static InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bicubic;     
025        
026        private final InterpolationMethod im;
027        private final Mapping2D mapping;
028        
029        /**
030         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping.
031         * The default pixel interpolation method is used
032         * (see {@link DefaultInterpolationMethod}).
033         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric mapping
034         */
035        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping) {
036                this(targetToSourceMapping, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
037        }
038
039        /**
040         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping
041         * and pixel interpolation method.
042         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric mapping
043         * @param im the pixel interpolation method
044         */
045        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping, InterpolationMethod im) {
046                this.mapping = targetToSourceMapping;
047                this.im = im;
048        }
049        
050        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        /**
053         * Destructively transforms the passed image using this geometric
054         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
055         * 
056         * @param ip target image to which this mapping is applied
057         */
058        public void map(ImageProcessor ip) {
059                // make a temporary copy of the image:
060                ImageProcessor source = ip.duplicate();
061                ImageProcessor target = ip;
062                map(source, target);
063                source = null;
064        }
065        
066        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        /**
069         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
070         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method. Note that source
071         * and target must be different images!
072         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
073         * target to source image coordinates!
074         * 
075         * @param source input image (not modified)
076         * @param target output image (modified)
077         */
078        public void map(ImageProcessor source, ImageProcessor target) {
079                if (target == source) {
080                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
081                }
082                ImageAccessor sourceAcc = ImageAccessor.create(source, null, im);
083                ImageAccessor targetAcc = ImageAccessor.create(target);
084                map(sourceAcc, targetAcc);
085        }
086
087        
088        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
089
090        /**
091         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
092         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
093         * The two images are passed as instances of {@link ImageAccessor}.
094         * Note that source and target reference different images!
095         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
096         * target to source image coordinates!
097         * 
098         * @param sourceAcc accessor to the source image
099         * @param targetAcc accessor to the target image
100         */
101        public void map(ImageAccessor sourceAcc, ImageAccessor targetAcc) {
102                if (targetAcc.getProcessor() == sourceAcc.getProcessor()) {
103                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
104                }
105                Mapping2D invMap = mapping;             // this always IS an inverse mapping!!
106                ImageProcessor target = targetAcc.getProcessor();
107                final int w = target.getWidth();
108                final int h = target.getHeight();
109                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
110                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
111                                Pnt2d sourcePt = invMap.applyTo(PntInt.from(u, v));
112                                float[] val = sourceAcc.getPix(sourcePt.getX(), sourcePt.getY());
113                                targetAcc.setPix(u, v, val);
114                        }
115                }
116        }
117
118}
